title: Which team will win the 2018 NCAA Division I Men's Basketball Championship?
preds: Michigan has the easiest entry 7:1 via loya.  Loya has won all its games by 1-2 points.  Not much noted is that Michigan isn't much better.  2:1 odds Villanova vs anyone else. - with an adjust if I lose = ).

Loyla-Chicago are the clear underdogs, so their region is assigned the lowest % (https://www.cbssports.com/college-basketball/news/2018-ncaa-tournament-final-four-odds-picks-advanced-computer-model-says-fade-loyola-chicago/). Consequently, this increases Michigan's chances by guaranteeing them a place in the final.  The Villanova V Kansas game is trickier to predict, so their %s will remain equal for now. (https://www.si.com/college-basketball/2018/villanova-kansas-results-history-all-time-ncaa-tournament-march-madness)

Base rate = .25 for all teams.   While I think both Villanova and Kansas are the best basketball teams left in the tournament, their paths are difficult since they have to face off against each other.  Therefore, I think many predictions assign these teams too high of odds. Michigan, on the other hand, has an easy path to the championship (unless Loyola pulls off yet another miracle).  I gave Michigan an 78% chance of winning against Loyola (possibly too high) and 42% chance of winning the championship game.

The winner of the East (#1 Villanova) vs Midwest (#1 Kansas) will almost certainly win the tournament, against either #11 Loyola-Chi or #3 Michigan.  Villanova's experience, coaching, and fundamental skills suggest it would win out well more than half the time.
A tentative initial forecast, presuming the strongest teams are distributed equally across the regions. Will update after research.

Dropped 10 off South to give to Midwest.  Seems to be down to Kansas or Villanova.  My first bracket ever I put UNC as champs on ESPN. And quite a high bunch of upsets. I got 23% then 17% now. LOL I suck! Never watched a College game in any sport in my life.
With Virginia out, it is either Villanova or Kansas
I watch a lot of basketball.

golden state big fav,+houston !!
maybe clevl and toronto for the east...
The first and second round upsets have been fun to watch (UMBC!!), but in the end it will be a complete team like Villanova or Kansas that will win the championship.
Coaches from the east have experience with clock management, time outs, fouls, etc...

Accidentally reversed scores in the last forecast from a few minutes ago. I know little about basketball, much less about college basketball teams. So I went to espn at the link below and looked at a couple dozen expert picks for the final four and winner. I gave each team a point when they were predicted for final four, and 2 points for the predicted winner.  Ended up being 150 points total split among the "expert" final four and winner selections. Took the percentages and placed them in the appropriate region using the bracket sheet in the second link. http://www.espn.com/mens-college-basketball/story/_/id/22738692/espn-experts-make-final-four-national-champion-predictions-2018-ncaa-tournament https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2018/03/11/sports/ncaa-bracket-printable.html
